00002 // SKError.h
00003 // Base error class thrown by all storage kit kernel interface functions
00004 //----------------------------------------------------------------------
00005 #ifndef _sk_error_h_
00006 #define _sk_error_h_
00007 
00008 const bool DO_DEBUG = true;
00009 
00010 class SKError {
00011     public:
00012         SKError(int error, const char* errorMessage = "Undefined Storage Kit Error");
00013         virtual ~SKError();
00014 
00015         const int Error() const;
00016         const char* ErrorMessage() const;
00017 
00018     private:
00019         SKError(const SKError &ref);
00020             // Make the copy constructor private so only pointers may be
00021             // thrown (more efficient; less copy construction going on)
00022         SKError();
00023             // Make the default constructor private so some sort
00024             // or error code has to be specified
00025         void InitErrorMessage(const char* errorMessage);
00026 
00027         int fError;
00028         char *fErrorMessage;        
00029         
00030 };
